body_html:
$ pip install backports.weakref>=1.0rc1
(does NOTHING - just exits)

@ebrevdo: The package name and the version should be covered in quotation marks here, as otherwise in the shell the > sign redirects the output to file named =1.0rc1.

$ pip --version
pip 1.5.4 from /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7)

$ pip install --user "backports.weakref>=1.0rc1"
Downloading/unpacking backports.weakref>=1.0rc1
  Downloading backports.weakref-1.0rc1-py2-none-any.whl
Installing collected packages: backports.weakref
Successfully installed backports.weakref
Cleaning up...

As I mentioned before, installing the tensorflow wheel package works fine for me if I change the version specifier inside the wheel from ==1.0rc1 to >=1.0rc1 (unzip wheel file; edit METADATA file in dist-info folder; zip changed package again).

I have also tested this on Ubuntu 14.04.05 LTS with pip 1.5.4, which works fine and downloads the rc1 package as expected:

$ uname -a
Linux ubuntu 4.4.0-31-generic #50~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jul 13 01:07:32 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ pip --version
pip 1.5.4 from /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7)

$ aptitude show python-setuptools
Package: python-setuptools                   
State: installed
Automatically installed: yes
Version: 3.3-1ubuntu2

$ pip install tensorflow-1.2.1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl 
Unpacking ./tensorflow-1.2.1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
Downloading/unpacking mock>=2.0.0 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
  Downloading mock-2.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (56kB): 56kB downloaded
Downloading/unpacking bleach==1.5.0 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
  Downloading bleach-1.5.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Downloading/unpacking numpy>=1.11.0 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
  Downloading numpy-1.13.0.zip (5.0MB): 5.0MB downloaded
  Running setup.py (path:/tmp/pip_build_ubuntu/numpy/setup.py) egg_info for package numpy
    Running from numpy source directory.
    /usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'python_requires'
      warnings.warn(msg)    
    warning: no previously-included files matching '*.pyc' found anywhere in distribution
    warning: no previously-included files matching '*.pyo' found anywhere in distribution
    warning: no previously-included files matching '*.pyd' found anywhere in distribution
Downloading/unpacking backports.weakref>=1.0rc1 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
  Downloading backports.weakref-1.0rc1-py2-none-any.whl
Downloading/unpacking markdown>=2.6.8 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
[...]

Your suggested change that was already implemented by @mdeff should be ok, but according to PEP440 "The use of == (without at least the wildcard suffix) when defining dependencies for published distributions is strongly discouraged as it greatly complicates the deployment of security fixes."

Edit: In the tensorflow installation instructions it is also strongly recommended to update pip to version 8.1 or higher.

Edit2: Added version infos for test on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

body:
> $ pip install backports.weakref>=1.0rc1
(does NOTHING - just exits)

@ebrevdo: The package name and the version should be covered in quotation marks here, as otherwise in the shell the `>` sign redirects the output to file named `=1.0rc1`.

```
$ pip --version
pip 1.5.4 from /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7)

$ pip install --user "backports.weakref>=1.0rc1"
Downloading/unpacking backports.weakref>=1.0rc1
  Downloading backports.weakref-1.0rc1-py2-none-any.whl
Installing collected packages: backports.weakref
Successfully installed backports.weakref
Cleaning up...
```

As I mentioned before, installing the tensorflow wheel package works fine for me if I change the version specifier inside the wheel from `==1.0rc1` to `>=1.0rc1` (unzip wheel file; edit METADATA file in dist-info folder; zip changed package again).

I have also tested this on Ubuntu 14.04.05 LTS with pip 1.5.4, which works fine and downloads the rc1 package as expected:

```
$ uname -a
Linux ubuntu 4.4.0-31-generic #50~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jul 13 01:07:32 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ pip --version
pip 1.5.4 from /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7)

$ aptitude show python-setuptools
Package: python-setuptools                   
State: installed
Automatically installed: yes
Version: 3.3-1ubuntu2

$ pip install tensorflow-1.2.1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl 
Unpacking ./tensorflow-1.2.1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
Downloading/unpacking mock>=2.0.0 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
  Downloading mock-2.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (56kB): 56kB downloaded
Downloading/unpacking bleach==1.5.0 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
  Downloading bleach-1.5.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Downloading/unpacking numpy>=1.11.0 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
  Downloading numpy-1.13.0.zip (5.0MB): 5.0MB downloaded
  Running setup.py (path:/tmp/pip_build_ubuntu/numpy/setup.py) egg_info for package numpy
    Running from numpy source directory.
    /usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'python_requires'
      warnings.warn(msg)    
    warning: no previously-included files matching '*.pyc' found anywhere in distribution
    warning: no previously-included files matching '*.pyo' found anywhere in distribution
    warning: no previously-included files matching '*.pyd' found anywhere in distribution
Downloading/unpacking backports.weakref>=1.0rc1 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
  Downloading backports.weakref-1.0rc1-py2-none-any.whl
Downloading/unpacking markdown>=2.6.8 (from tensorflow==1.2.1)
[...]
```

Your suggested change that was already implemented by @mdeff should be ok, but according to PEP440 *"The use of == (without at least the wildcard suffix) when defining dependencies for published distributions is strongly discouraged as it greatly complicates the deployment of security fixes."*

Edit: In the tensorflow installation instructions it is also strongly recommended to update pip to version 8.1 or higher.

Edit2: Added version infos for test on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS
